author: lovegrovegeorge
title: Catalyst Site: Project tracking
description: There is a lack of visibility on the execution of the proposal winners and their total amount of funded proposals.

assessments.note: This is very important. The history of funded projects in meeting their objectives needs to be tracked to avoid repeating the same mistakes.

The identified problem has already started to manifest in Project Catalyst and if not addressed sooner rather than later it could become unmanageable or much harder to address. This is a prime example of members of the community actively trying to improve the decision making process for the whole Catalyst community.

Increasing resources for a good and informed decision making process is very important for decentralised decision making from the viewpoint of quality of made decisions as well as for lowering entry barriers for CAs and voters. The catalyst process would gravely benefit from such a resource.

The problem and solution statement described is reasonable. The proposal has the potential to have a positive impact on Catalyst, but the concept of this proposal is more related to the auditability of proposals that have already been funded than to decision making, but that does not make the proposal any less important.

The availability of a history of proposals and teams of proposers and their performance in previous Funds, allows the community to have more information about recurring proposals / teams in Catalyst

Yes, this is highly needed. It is difficult at the moment to know what the previous projects that got funded are doing and where to find information about them. Also for accountability this is important. We want to give funds to the people actually improving the ecosystem and helping other entrepreneurs build their products later on.

The idea to make more transparent and easier the access to the funded proposals have a great potential. With this, you could try to figure out which characteristics of each successful projects have in common as well as the failed ones. That said, this could create a database for the CA and proposers to improve their judge on voting, if CA, and improve their proposal, if proposer. Therefore, it will potentially improve the decision making.
Some ideas that could help with this project in the future is: if possible, create graphs that make clear the common points among the successful projects and another one with those who failed; open a channel to allow the failed project's team to talk about why they think it failed, where they could have improved – it might help another proposer.

The List of projects being funded and their progress are diligently covered in town halls however a website can provide a ready reference and can definitely improve the visibility of progress and transparency. There is a need to unify all community sites for better UI.

I fully support this proposal. This is well-in-line with a number of other proposals and has the potential to become part of an overall CATALYST Community Toolset. 

 Please make sure that you investigate the following along the road:
1) How can this complement other similar proposals, like cardanocataly.st landing page, Catalyst Community Tools and Visual communication for community ?
2) Strategically discuss in a wider group, if this should migrate into IdeaScale or become part of an overall, CATALYST Community-run we space and toolset ?

I also added some comments earlier in the feedback phase, which I want to repeat here:

" I would dream of a clustered project-funnel, which shown the various projects in its stages over their lifecycle, clustered according to the nature/scope of the project, could be similar to COIN360.com  and e.g. colored according to ROI achievement (following different KPI mix along the life-cycle).
This could of course also be a feature directly on IdeaScale, but maybe a dedicated website is easier to do."
The plan is well presented and it is likely the prospers can deliver on it, though more detail on their experience would be helpful.

Success is not only in creating another tool, but also ensure that the data quality is good enough. The proposal seems to implicitly assume that someone else will curate the data on an ongoing basis but it is not clear who.

I truly see no obstacle in the implementation of the primary objective of the proposal, building the website. The team seems competent, motivated and experienced. They have budgeted their proposal very fairly, but at a doable rate.
The team has the neccessary experience to implement such a project and provides structured information on how it plans to achieve the plans set.

The team is composed of 3 members with experiences in web / mobile developmnet, research & analysis, marketing, documentation and management. Based on the information described, I believe that the team has the capacity to execute the proposal.

The plan described is reasonable and detailed, with an objective timeline. The plan involves tracking proposals that have already been funded and the amount that has already been made available for each proposal over time.

The budget described is reasonable and has details on the allocation of resources.

The team is alright. It will take some coordination to make this, but it should be possible to build a simple product, which could be improved to include more information and more streamlined over time.

I do like the idea of the team be diverse and experienced in their areas. The budget is well structured, taking into account even the hours of work per week (which is not a common thing we see here).
It was not clear to me the method they will use if the project scales up, meaning that how they are going to allocate all the data needed to provide all the information that they intend. Maybe include this in the proposal will make it more credible.
The technical process is simple and the experience of the proposers is adequate to implement the proposal sucessully.

Excellent description of the team and the basic problem, solution, added-value, actions, roadmap and costs. Well-done. Provided that there is a good interaction with other similar initiatives, this proposal has excellent chances to succeed and add value
This is a well thought out and detailed plan. it addresses a key element of effective decision making, evaluating the success of previous decisions.
Like I wrote in an assessment to another proposal belonging to the same project: They create a nail but it is unclear who the person with the hammer is.

The information provided is very clear and on point. The only real concern/lack that I have identified with the proposal is one that has been addressed in the comments section as well: who will actively maintain the website after it launches? The proposed solution is an automated one, but even that will have to be maintained from time to time. But still it's an initiative well worth starting.
i'm a bit concerned by the after, doing a website is the simplest task managing it will be the hard work

The information on what is planned to be achieved is clear, the time budget is transparent and credible considering the experiece of the team, making its feasibility highly likely. The use of the project for adressing the challenge is obvious and its success will be easy to audit once it is updated in future catalyst rounds and and the change of the success can be measured comparing different funding rounds.

There is clarity in the problem and the solution described. The proposal is in line with the challenge.

There is a detailed plan, there is an objective timeline, success metrics and details on budget allocation.

No KPIs have been described. I recommend the inclusion of links to Linkedin for all members, so that the community has access to more information from the proposers in a transparent way.
I think they have outlined well why it is needed and what they will include. They have also described well what they will do with the funds. I think it is a good proposal.

It is very clear what they are aiming and since it's an open platform, meaning that will be lots of users, it will be easy to verify if they're complying. Another thing is that there are already tracking their development, which is good.
I think it might help if you use as matric the, hopefully, increasing number of successful projects along the time – since the aim of this idea is to create a better environment for decision making and a credible place for proposers extract information and better develop their ideas.
The proposal is simple and has clearly identified test points. The progress can be easily monitored.

Very detailed inputs are provided. This certainly allows for good audibility. Please make sure to stretch out to similar initiatives early in the project, so that a maximum of synergies can be created.

solution: Provide all funding history for projects and linking projects to their products / websites.
experience:
5+ years of web and mobile development experience

1 year of strategic consulting (external & inhouse) experience
